svcprocinfo.para: When the crankcase lube oil is contaminated with coolant, the oil will have a dark-gray or black sludgy appearance. The crankcase may also be overfilled.

item.para: If coolant is leaking from air compressor, repair or replace air compressor.

step1.para: Pressurize cooling system to 96 kPa (14 psi). Look for coolant leaks.

item.para: If the engine is equipped with an air compressor, and is leaking from the compressor oil drain-back hose or from the left side of the front cover, do "Air Compressor Leak Test."
If the engine does not have an air compressor, and is leaking from the front cover area or the oil pick-up tube, do "Front Cover Inspection" .
If a leak is noticed between the cylinder sleeve and piston, replace the injector sleeve for that cylinder. Follow the procedure in the Engine Service Manual.
If a leak is noticed between the cylinder sleeve and the engine block, replace the cylinder sleeve crevice seal for that cylinder. Follow the procedure in the Engine Service Manual.
If a leak is noticed from the oil drain-back ports (camshaft side), do "Cylinder Head Leak Test" .
If no leak is noticed, leave pressure on cooling system overnight and check the following day.
If no leak is noticed after overnight pressure test, do the following sequential tests until problem is found:

step1.para: After any repairs are complete, test the cooling system again to validate the repair.
Drain coolant from the system.
Remove the coolant inlet and outlet hoses for the air compressor from the crankcase.
Fill air compressor coolant passage and hoses with coolant.
Adapt air pressure fitting and regulator to one of the coolant hoses and block opposite hose.
Pressurize air compressor coolant hoses to 96 kPa (14 psi).
Inspect for coolant leakage from oil drain-back hose or left side of front cover. Listen for air escaping.

item.para: If a leak is noticed, repair or replace the air compressor.
If coolant is not leaking, do "Front Cover Inspection" .

step1.para: Test the cooling system again after any repair to validate the repair.

Remove front cover and inspect gaskets and sealing surfaces following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual. Check front cover and crankcase with straight edge and feeler gauge. Repair or replace as required.
Test the cooling system again after any repair to validate the repair.
Remove the valve cover following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual.
Pressurize the cooling system to 96 kPa (14 psi)
Inspect the entire cylinder head for cracks or leaks at the cup plugs.

item.para: If a leak is noticed, repair or replace.
If no leaks are noticed, do step 4.

step1.para: Drain coolant from system.
Remove cylinder head from engine following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual.
Inspect and pressure test the cylinder head following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: Inspect cylinder head gasket for damage at sealing points that may have caused a leak. Verify crankcase and cylinder head surface flatness using a straightedge and feeler gauge. Replace the head gasket. Repair or replace the cylinder head if necessary.
Inspect the cylinder head for cracks in the coolant passages. Repair or replace.

step1.para: If cylinder head is in good condition, remove cylinder sleeve crevice seals following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: Inspect the engine block for cracks in the coolant passages. Repair or replace.
Inspect for damaged cylinder liners and seals. Repair or replace.

step1.para: Test the cooling system again after any repair to validate the repair.
